event.title: the time of European encounter, the Chiska had a chief village near what is now

data.event: At the time of European encounter, the Chiska had a chief village near what is now Saltville, destroyed by the Spaniards in 1568.
At the time of European encounter, the Chiska had a chief village near what is now Saltville, destroyed by the Spaniards in 1568.

event.title: annexed the region from the Xualae around 1671

data.event: The Cherokee annexed the region from the Xualae around 1671, and ceded it to the Virginia Colony in 1770 at the Treaty of Lochaber.

event.title: ceded it to the Virginia Colony in 1770

data.event: The Cherokee annexed the region from the Xualae around 1671, and ceded it to the Virginia Colony in 1770 at the Treaty of Lochaber.
The county was formed by Virginians in 1776 from Fincastle County.
In July, 1776, Chief Dragging Canoe led an attack on Black's Fort (renamed Abingdon in 1778).

event.title: an attack on Black's Fort (renamed Abingdon in 1778

data.event: In July, 1776, Chief Dragging Canoe led an attack on Black's Fort (renamed Abingdon in 1778).

event.title: was finally slain by settlers in Washington County in 1794

data.event: The area remained prone to attack until after Chickamauga leader Bob Benge was finally slain by settlers in Washington County in 1794.
